name: OKR Framework Development
description: Develop quarterly or annual OKRs (Objectives and Key Results) for a department or division. Includes historical analysis, benchmarking, stakeholder alignment, and creating measurable key results tied to strategic priorities.

currentProcess.description: Review prior period OKRs and score achievement
painPoints: Scoring criteria inconsistent quarter to quarter
Need to reconcile what was actually achieved vs planned
Strategic direction sometimes unclear or conflicting
Translating vision into measurable outcomes is hard

currentProcess.description: Research industry benchmarks and competitor OKRs
painPoints: Industry benchmarks hard to find for specific metrics
Ensuring key results are truly measurable

currentProcess.description: Map dependencies between objectives and teams
painPoints: Cross-functional dependencies hard to identify upfront
Communicating final OKRs to all teams

aiProcess.description: Analyze prior OKRs and generate performance summary
aiProcess.toolRationale: Gemini handles structured data analysis well; can calculate scores and identify patterns
aiProcess.expectedOutput: Summary of prior OKR achievement with patterns and lessons learned
tips: Note any OKRs that were abandoned mid-quarter and why

aiProcess.toolRationale: Perplexity provides cited, current research on industry benchmarks
aiProcess.expectedOutput: Benchmark data with sources; competitor strategy insights if available
tips: Search for '[industry] OKR examples' and '[metric] benchmark 2025'
Save sources for credibility in stakeholder discussions

aiProcess.toolRationale: Claude excels at structured strategic thinking and generating alternatives
aiProcess.expectedOutput: 3-4 distinct OKR options with rationale for each approach

aiProcess.toolRationale: Claude can reason about cross-functional relationships systematically
aiProcess.expectedOutput: Dependency matrix showing which OKRs require coordination
tips: Ask about timing dependencies, not just resource dependencies

aiProcess.toolRationale: Human facilitation required; AI can help prep talking points

aiProcess.description: Create final OKR documentation and communication
aiProcess.toolRationale: ChatGPT writes clear, polished documentation quickly
aiProcess.expectedOutput: Final OKR document with tracking template and team communication
tips: Create different versions for different audiences
Include 'definition of done' for each key result

aiProcess.toolRationale: Human review critical; AI assists with iterations
aiProcess.expectedOutput: Approved, finalized OKR framework ready for implementation

whyItMatters: OKRs drive organizational focus and alignment. Poorly constructed OKRs lead to wasted effort, misaligned teams, and missed strategic opportunities. At AAA, well-designed OKRs across divisions enabled coordinated execution on $27M+ initiatives.
commonMistakes: Setting too many objectives (3-5 is ideal, not 10)
Key results that aren't actually measurable ('improve customer satisfaction' vs '85+ NPS')
Not connecting OKRs to strategic priorities - they become busywork
Setting 100% achievable targets (good OKRs should be 60-70% achievable)
tips: Use AI to generate alternatives, but you make the final call on ambition level
Have AI stress-test your OKRs: 'What could cause us to miss this?'
Ask AI to translate objectives into different framings for different audiences
Keep a 'rejected OKR' list with reasons - useful for next quarter
sources: Measure What Matters - John Doerr (OKR methodology)
Aditya Goyal AAA Experience - Built OKR frameworks across divisions
